alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued December 05 at 3:58AM PST until December 05 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in widespread dense fog. Pockets of visibility as low as 200 feet are likely, especially early this morning. * WHERE...Central Willamette Valley and South Willamette Valley. * WHEN...Until noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures were just above freezing across most of the central and southern Willamette Valley as of 4 AM this morning. Isolated pockets of subfreezing temperatures are likely, especially in outlying valleys Albany northward. Drivers should be prepared for icy roads this morning in case temperatures fall another couple of degrees.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Cyclists and pedestrians should consider wearing bright or reflective clothing to increase the chances of being seen by others in the dense fog.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; South Willamette Valley
